plan_metadata.name: AYAHUASCA INTERMEDIATE
plan_metadata.target_athlete: Intermediate cyclist, time-crunched (3-5 hrs/week), performance-focused finish
plan_metadata.goal: Maximum FTP gains and race-ready threshold power with minimal time investment

workouts.name: W01 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Welcome to time-crunched training. You have 3-5 hours per week and want performance, not just completion. This plan uses G-Spot (87-92% FTP) and Threshold (95-105% FTP) because they deliver maximum fitness gains in minimum time. Every minute counts. No junk miles. You'll do 2-3 quality sessions per week with everything else as rest or very light recovery. This is about FTP gains and race pace power—the most important metrics for gravel racing success.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Foundation week. Tuesday has FTP test (20 min max sustained effort). Thursday introduces G-Spot intervals (3x10 min). Saturday is tempo endurance (75-90 min). This week establishes your baseline and introduces time-efficient intensity.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W01 Tue - FTP Test
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
20 min warmup with 3x1 min efforts → 5 min all-out → 10 min recovery → 20 min max sustained effort → 10 min cooldown

• Classic 20-minute test. This is HARD but not a sprint—sustainable max effort for full 20 minutes. Pace it: start controlled, hold steady, push final 5 min. Average power × 0.95 = FTP. Write it down. This number drives your training for 12 weeks. Don't sandbag it—you need accurate zones.

• CADENCE: Self-selected for test effort.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1200" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="60" Power="1.10"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="60" Power="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="60" Power="1.10"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="60" Power="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="60" Power="1.10"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="60" Power="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="300" Power="1.20"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="600" Power="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1200" Power="1.05"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W01 Wed - Rest
workouts.description:
• Full rest day. Testing was maximal effort. Your body needs recovery.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W01 Thu - G-Spot Introduction
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 3x10 min @ 87-92% FTP (5 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• First G-Spot session. This is "uncomfortably sustainable"—harder than tempo, easier than threshold. You should be able to hold steady power but conversation is difficult. This zone maximizes aerobic gains without crushing fatigue. If you're blowing up, back off 3-5%. Quality matters more than hitting exact watts.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—interval 1 high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 low cadence (40-60 rpm), interval 3 self-selected.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="600" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W01 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Rest day. Time-crunched training requires disciplined rest. Two quality sessions need genuine recovery between them.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W01 Sat - Tempo Endurance
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
20 min easy → 3x12 min @ 80-85% FTP (4 min easy between) → 15 min easy

• Longest ride of week. Tempo (upper Z3) builds aerobic capacity and teaches your body to sustain power. "Comfortably hard"—you can talk but don't want to. Eat 40-50g carbs during ride. Practice race fueling now.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on tempo blocks.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1200" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.825" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.68" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W01 Sun - Rest or Very Easy Spin
workouts.description:
• Optional: 30 min Z1 (50-60% FTP)

• Default is rest. Only spin if you feel great. Time-crunched = quality over quantity. Save energy for next week's hard sessions.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W02 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Week 2 increases G-Spot interval duration. You're building as much threshold power as possible in limited time. G-Spot is your primary weapon—87-92% FTP is the most time-efficient intensity for FTP gains. Three quality sessions this week. Make every one count.

• WEEK PREVIEW: G-Spot foundation building. Tuesday has extended G-Spot intervals (3x12 min). Thursday introduces threshold work (2x12 min). Saturday is weekend key session (90-105 min with mixed intensity). This week builds sustainable power.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W02 Tue - G-Spot Progression
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 3x12 min @ 87-92% FTP (5 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Longer intervals than Week 1. Total time at G-Spot = 36 minutes. This should feel sustainably hard. Control your breathing, stay smooth, don't spike power at interval starts. If you're fading on interval 3, you're pushing correctly.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—interval 1 high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 low cadence (40-60 rpm), interval 3 self-selected.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W02 Wed - Rest
workouts.description:
• Recovery day. G-Spot fatigues you more than you think. Rest enables Thursday's quality.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W02 Thu - Threshold Introduction
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 2x12 min @ 95-100% FTP (6 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• First threshold work at race pace intensity. This is HARD—breathing labored but rhythmic. Not gasping, but working. This is what gravel racing feels like—sustained near-max effort. Should finish thinking "maybe one more." If power drops >5% on interval 2, back off 3% next time.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—interval 1 high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 low cadence (40-60 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="100" OffDuration="360" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W02 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Rest day. Two quality sessions done this week. Your body needs recovery.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W02 Sat - Weekend Key Session
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
20 min easy → 2x15 min @ 87-92% FTP (6 min easy between) → 10 min easy → 3x8 min @ 80-85% FTP (3 min easy between) → 15 min easy

• Biggest session of week. G-Spot when fresh, tempo when fatigued. This builds both power and endurance in one time-efficient ride. Total structured time = 54 minutes. Eat 50-60g carbs during ride. Practice fueling under stress.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on G-Spot blocks—one high cadence (100+ rpm), one low cadence (40-60 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1200" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="360" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="600" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="480" OnPower="0.825" Cadence="100" OffDuration="180" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.68" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W02 Sun - Rest or Active Recovery
workouts.description:
• Optional: 30-40 min Z1

• Default is rest. Light spin only if feeling recovered. Time-crunched training = aggressive rest strategy.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W03 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Week 3 is your biggest volume of base phase. You'll do maximum G-Spot and Threshold your body can handle in 3-5 hours. By Saturday you should feel accumulated fatigue—that's overload working. Week 4 backs off so your body adapts. This week builds the FTP that carries you through race day.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Peak G-Spot volume week. Tuesday has maximum G-Spot volume (4x12 min). Thursday has extended threshold (2x15 min). Saturday is biggest session of plan (105-120 min with mixed intensity). This is your "A" week.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W03 Tue - Peak G-Spot
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 4x12 min @ 87-92% FTP (5 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Four intervals—most yet. 48 minutes total at G-Spot. This is HARD. Break it down mentally—one interval at a time. Stay controlled, steady power, don't blow up on interval 1. If you fade on interval 4, that's perfect—you pushed hard enough.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—intervals 1, 3 at high cadence (100+ rpm), intervals 2, 4 at low cadence (40-60 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W03 Wed - Rest
workouts.description:
• Full rest day after biggest G-Spot session. Non-negotiable.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W03 Thu - Threshold Progression
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 2x15 min @ 95-100% FTP (7 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Longer threshold blocks. 30 minutes total at race pace. This should be sustainably hard—breathing labored but controlled. This is what gravel racing demands. If you can't complete 15 min, do 12 min—better to finish strong than blow up.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—interval 1 high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 low cadence (40-60 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="100" OffDuration="420" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W03 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Rest day. Two massive quality sessions this week. Recovery is training.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W03 Sat - Biggest Session of Plan
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min easy → 3x15 min @ 87-92% FTP (6 min easy between) → 15 min easy → 3x10 min @ 80-85% FTP (4 min easy between) → 15 min easy

• Longest and hardest ride of base phase. 45 min G-Spot + 30 min tempo = 75 minutes structured work in 2-hour ride. This is time-efficient training at its peak. Eat 60g carbs during ride. Practice race nutrition—this matters as much as the power.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on G-Spot blocks—intervals 1, 3 at high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 at low cadence (40-60 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1500" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="360" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="600" OnPower="0.825" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.68" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W03 Sun - Rest or Easy Spin
workouts.description:
• Optional: 30-45 min Z1

• Default is rest. You should feel tired after this week—heavy legs, general fatigue. That's appropriate overload, not overtraining. Only spin if you feel surprisingly good.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W04 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Recovery week. Your body adapts during rest, not during work. By Friday you should feel fresh and strong. If you're still tired by Sunday, you pushed too hard in Week 3 or aren't sleeping/eating enough. This is when the magic happens—your FTP increases during recovery, not during intervals.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Recovery week. Tuesday has light G-Spot (2x10 min, easier). Thursday is easy endurance. Saturday is moderate endurance with light tempo touch. This is when adaptation happens.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W04 Tue - Light G-Spot
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
10 min warmup → 2x10 min @ 85-90% FTP (5 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Lighter than Week 3. Maintains neuromuscular recruitment patterns without adding fatigue. Should feel controlled and relatively comfortable. If it feels hard, you're not recovered—skip intervals and just ride 45 min easy.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—one high cadence (100+ rpm), one low cadence (40-60 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="600" OnPower="0.875" Cadence="90" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W04 Wed - Rest
workouts.description:
• Full rest day.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W04 Thu - Easy Endurance
workouts.description:
• Duration: 40-50 min

• Zones: Z2 (65-75% FTP)

• Notes: Truly easy. Conversational pace. Just moving legs. Active recovery aids adaptation.

• CADENCE: Self-selected (85-95 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="2400" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W04 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Rest day. You should be feeling fresh and strong by now.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W04 Sat - Moderate Endurance
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
20 min easy → 2x12 min @ 75-80% FTP (4 min easy between) → 15 min easy

• No real intensity stress. Light tempo maintains fitness. This should feel comfortable. Check bike—make sure everything works. Address any fit issues now.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on tempo blocks.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1200" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.78" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.68" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W04 Sun - Rest
workouts.description:
• Full rest day. Preparing for build phase.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W05 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Build phase begins. Weeks 5-8 progressively increase threshold work while maintaining G-Spot foundation. You're building race-specific power now—the ability to sustain high percentages of FTP for extended periods. This is what gravel racing demands.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Threshold development week. Tuesday has G-Spot maintenance (3x12 min). Thursday has progressive threshold (3x12 min). Saturday is long mixed ride (100-120 min with G-Spot + threshold). This week increases threshold volume.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W05 Tue - G-Spot Maintenance
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 3x12 min @ 87-92% FTP (5 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Maintaining G-Spot adaptations while emphasizing threshold this phase. Should feel controlled—you've done this before. Quality execution matters.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—interval 1 high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 low cadence (40-60 rpm), interval 3 self-selected.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W05 Wed - Rest
workouts.description:
• Recovery day between quality sessions.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W05 Thu - Threshold Development
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 3x12 min @ 95-100% FTP (6 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Three 12-minute threshold blocks—36 minutes total at race pace. This is hard but you've built the fitness for this. Breathing labored, legs burning, but sustainable. This builds the power you'll race with.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—intervals 1, 3 at high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 at low cadence (40-60 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="100" OffDuration="360" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W05 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Rest day. Two quality sessions need proper recovery.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W05 Sat - Long Mixed Ride
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min easy → 2x20 min @ 87-92% FTP (8 min easy between) → 20 min easy → 2x10 min @ 95-100% FTP (5 min easy between) → 15 min easy

• Big session—G-Spot when fresh, threshold when fatigued. This simulates race demands. 40 min G-Spot + 20 min threshold = 60 minutes quality in 2-hour ride. Eat 60-70g carbs/hour. This is race practice.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on G-Spot and threshold blocks.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1800" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="1200" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="480" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1200" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="600" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.68" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W05 Sun - Rest or Very Easy Spin
workouts.description:
• Optional: 30 min Z1

• Default is rest. Save energy for Week 6 intensity.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W06 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Intensity increases this week. Peak threshold volume—the most race-specific training in the plan. By Saturday you should feel threshold-specific fatigue (legs burn faster, threshold feels harder). That's adaptation. Week 8 recovery converts this to performance.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Peak threshold volume week. Tuesday has G-Spot maintenance (3x12 min). Thursday has peak threshold (2x20 min). Saturday is maximum mixed session (110-120 min with G-Spot + threshold). This week builds race-specific power.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W06 Tue - G-Spot Maintenance
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 3x12 min @ 87-92% FTP (5 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Maintaining G-Spot base. Execute cleanly—you need this foundation for threshold work.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—interval 1 high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 low cadence (40-60 rpm), interval 3 self-selected.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W06 Wed - Rest
workouts.description:
• Recovery day. Preparing for big threshold session.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W06 Thu - Peak Threshold
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 2x20 min @ 95-100% FTP (10 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Classic 2x20 at threshold. 40 minutes total at race pace. This is HARD. Break 20-minute blocks into 4x5 mentally. Stay smooth, controlled breathing, steady power. This is what separates time-crunched athletes who perform from those who just finish.

• RHYTHM INTERVALS: For one interval, try rhythm pattern: 2 min Z3 (self-selected cadence) + 1 min Z4 (high cadence 100+ rpm) x 4, continuous. This simulates race variability.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences or use rhythm pattern.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="1200" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="100" OffDuration="600" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W06 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Rest after peak threshold. Non-negotiable.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W06 Sat - Maximum Mixed Session
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min easy → 3x15 min @ 87-92% FTP (6 min easy between) → 15 min easy → 2x12 min @ 95-100% FTP (7 min easy between) → 15 min easy

• Biggest session—45 min G-Spot + 24 min threshold = 69 minutes quality work. This is maximum time-efficient training. Should feel strong—weeks of build prepared you. Eat 70g carbs/hour. This is full race dress rehearsal for fueling.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on G-Spot and threshold blocks.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1800" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="360" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="100" OffDuration="420" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.68" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W06 Sun - Rest or Easy Spin
workouts.description:
• Optional: 30-40 min Z1

• Default is rest. You should feel accumulated fatigue from this week.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W07 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Final high-volume week before recovery. You're consolidating all the threshold work from Weeks 5-6. Should feel strong in these intervals now—power that felt crushing in Week 5 should feel more sustainable. That's your FTP increasing.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Sustained threshold week. Tuesday has G-Spot + openers (3x10 min + 4x1 min). Thursday has sustained threshold (3x15 min). Saturday is peak long ride (110-120 min with G-Spot + threshold). This week consolidates threshold gains.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W07 Tue - G-Spot + Openers
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 3x10 min @ 87-92% FTP (5 min easy between) → 5 min easy → 4x1 min @ 105% FTP (2 min easy between) → 5 min cooldown

• G-Spot maintains base, openers add sharpness. The 1-min efforts should feel snappy—keeping neuromuscular system responsive while building threshold base.

• RHYTHM INTERVALS: For one G-Spot interval, try rhythm pattern: 2 min Z3 (self-selected cadence) + 1 min Z4 (high cadence 100+ rpm) x 3, continuous. This simulates race variability.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on G-Spot blocks. High cadence (100+ rpm) on openers.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="600" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="300" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="60" OnPower="1.05" Cadence="100" OffDuration="120" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="300" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W07 Wed - Rest
workouts.description:
• Recovery day between quality sessions.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W07 Thu - Sustained Threshold
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 3x15 min @ 95-100% FTP (7 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Three 15-minute blocks—45 minutes total at threshold. Should feel controlled and strong. This is race pace for extended periods. You've built this fitness. Execute confidently.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—intervals 1, 3 at high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 at low cadence (40-60 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="100" OffDuration="420" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W07 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Rest day preparing for weekend session.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W07 Sat - Peak Long Ride
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min easy → 4x12 min @ 87-92% FTP (5 min easy between) → 15 min easy → 3x8 min @ 95-100% FTP (5 min easy between) → 15 min easy

• Peak session—48 min G-Spot + 24 min threshold = 72 minutes quality. This is your fitness ceiling before recovery phase. Eat 70-80g carbs/hour. Test all race-day gear and nutrition.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on G-Spot and threshold blocks.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1800" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="480" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.68" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W07 Sun - Rest or Easy Spin
workouts.description:
• Optional: 30-45 min Z1

• Default is rest. You just completed hardest training block.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W08 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Recovery week after peak build. By Friday you should feel fresh, strong, powerful. This is when Weeks 5-7 work converts into higher FTP. If you're still tired by Sunday, you pushed too hard or need to address recovery habits (sleep, nutrition, stress).

• WEEK PREVIEW: Recovery week. Tuesday has light G-Spot (2x10 min). Thursday is easy endurance. Saturday is moderate endurance with light tempo touch. This is when training stress converts to performance.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W08 Tue - Light G-Spot
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
10 min warmup → 2x10 min @ 85-90% FTP (5 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Light work maintains fitness. Should feel easy and controlled.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—one high cadence (100+ rpm), one low cadence (40-60 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="600" OnPower="0.875" Cadence="90" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W08 Wed - Rest
workouts.description:
• Full rest day.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W08 Thu - Easy Endurance
workouts.description:
• Duration: 40-50 min

• Zones: Z2 (65-75% FTP)

• Notes: Easy pace. Just moving legs.

• CADENCE: Self-selected (85-95 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="2400" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W08 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Rest day. Feeling fresh now.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W08 Sat - Moderate Endurance
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
Z2 (65-75% FTP), add 2x10 min @ 80-85% FTP in final 30 min (4 min easy between)

• No real intensity stress. Light tempo touches. Check all equipment.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on tempo blocks.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="2400" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="600" OnPower="0.825" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="600" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W08 Sun - Rest
workouts.description:
• Full rest. Preparing for race prep phase.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W09 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Final four weeks. Training becomes race-specific—sustained efforts at race pace, mixed intensities simulating race surges and sustained climbs. Your FTP is built. Now we sharpen it for race day.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Race prep begins. Tuesday has race pace intervals (3x12 min @ 90-95% FTP). Thursday has G-Spot + race surges (2x12 min + 4x2 min). Saturday is long race simulation (100-110 min). This week practices race-specific efforts.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W09 Tue - Race Pace Intervals
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 3x12 min @ 90-95% FTP (5 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Race pace—right at threshold. This is what gravel racing feels like for time-crunched athletes who trained smart. Should feel sustainable. Practice drinking while holding power.

• RHYTHM INTERVALS: For one interval, try rhythm pattern: 2 min Z3 (self-selected cadence) + 1 min Z4 (high cadence 100+ rpm) x 4, continuous. This simulates race variability.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences or use rhythm pattern.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.93" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W09 Wed - Rest
workouts.description:
• Recovery day.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W09 Thu - G-Spot + Race Surges
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 2x12 min @ 87-92% FTP (5 min easy between) → 10 min easy → 4x2 min @ 105% FTP (3 min easy between) → 5 min cooldown

• G-Spot simulates sustained efforts. 2-min surges simulate attacks or short climbs. This is race-specific power training.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on G-Spot blocks. High cadence (100+ rpm) on surges.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="600" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="120" OnPower="1.05" Cadence="100" OffDuration="180" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="300" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W09 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Rest day before weekend key session.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W09 Sat - Long Race Simulation
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min easy → 3x15 min @ 87-95% FTP (varied within range, 7 min easy between) → Final 30 min easy

• Race simulation—variable efforts when tired. 45 minutes at race-type power. Eat 60-70g carbs/hour. Practice race-day nutrition and hydration protocols.

• LOADED INTERVALS: For one interval, try loaded pattern: 1 min Z5/Z6 (high cadence, seated) → settle into 14 min Z3 (self-selected cadence). This simulates race starts.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences or use loaded/rhythm patterns.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1800" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.91" Cadence="100" OffDuration="420" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1800" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W09 Sun - Rest or Easy Spin
workouts.description:
• Optional: 30 min Z1

• Default is rest.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W10 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Second-to-last build week. You should feel strong and sharp now. Two more quality weeks, then taper. Race logistics: check bike, order nutrition products, confirm travel. Mental preparation begins.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Peak sharpness week. Tuesday has threshold + openers (2x15 min + 3x1 min). Thursday has G-Spot maintenance (3x12 min). Saturday is final long race prep (105-120 min). This week is final race-specific sharpening.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W10 Tue - Threshold Sharpness
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 2x15 min @ 95-100% FTP (8 min easy between) → 8 min easy → 3x1 min @ 110% FTP (2 min easy between) → 5 min cooldown

• Threshold maintains race pace fitness. Openers keep top-end sharp. Should feel powerful—this is peak fitness manifesting.

• RHYTHM INTERVALS: For one interval, try rhythm pattern: 2 min Z3 (self-selected cadence) + 1 min Z4 (high cadence 100+ rpm) x 4, continuous. This simulates race variability.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences or use rhythm pattern. High cadence (100+ rpm) on openers.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="100" OffDuration="480" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="480" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="60" OnPower="1.10" Cadence="100" OffDuration="120" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="300" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W10 Wed - Rest
workouts.description:
• Recovery day.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W10 Thu - G-Spot Maintenance
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 3x12 min @ 87-92% FTP (5 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Maintaining G-Spot foundation during sharpening phase.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—interval 1 high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 low cadence (40-60 rpm), interval 3 self-selected.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W10 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Rest before final long session.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W10 Sat - Final Long Race Prep
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min easy → 3x15 min @ 90-100% FTP (varied, 7 min easy between) → Final 30-45 min easy

• Final race simulation. Variable race-pace efforts. 45 minutes of quality work. Eat 70g carbs/hour. Test EVERYTHING today—this is your last chance for full race rehearsal.

• LOADED INTERVALS: For one interval, try loaded pattern: 1 min Z5/Z6 (high cadence, seated) → settle into 14 min Z3 (self-selected cadence). This simulates race starts and surges.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences or use loaded/rhythm patterns.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1800" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.95" Cadence="100" OffDuration="420" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="2400" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W10 Sun - Rest or Easy Spin
workouts.description:
• Optional: 30 min Z1

• Default is rest.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W11 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Taper begins. Volume drops 30%, intensity stays sharp. You should feel increasingly fresh each day while maintaining power. Time-crunched training + smart taper = race-ready fitness.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Taper begins. Tuesday has taper quality (3x8 min @ 90-95% FTP). Thursday is easy endurance. Saturday has moderate ride with touches (75-90 min). Volume drops, intensity stays sharp.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W11 Tue - Taper Quality
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min warmup → 3x8 min @ 90-95% FTP (4 min easy between) → 10 min cooldown

• Reduced volume, maintained intensity. Should feel controlled and powerful. Race pace should feel easier than it did in Week 10.

• CADENCE WORK: High cadence on all efforts (100+ rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="900" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="480" OnPower="0.93" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W11 Wed - Rest
workouts.description:
• Full rest day.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W11 Thu - Easy Endurance
workouts.description:
• Duration: 30-40 min

• Zones: Z2 (65-75% FTP)

• Notes: Short easy ride. Just moving legs.

• CADENCE: Self-selected (85-95 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1800" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W11 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Scheduled rest.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W11 Sat - Moderate Ride with Touches
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min easy → 2x10 min @ 87-92% FTP (5 min easy between) → Final 30 min easy

• Shorter ride, maintains intensity stimulus. Should feel strong and fresh. This is final "reminder" workout before race week.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on G-Spot blocks.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1800" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="600" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1800" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W11 Sun - Rest
workouts.description:
• Full rest day.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W12 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Race week. Volume drops dramatically. You should feel fresh, powerful, ready. You trained smart for 11 weeks with limited time. G-Spot and Threshold built your FTP. Now execute: pace conservatively early, fuel from mile 1, push when it counts.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Race week! Tuesday is easy spin (30 min). Wednesday has final openers. Thursday is rest or easy spin. Friday is pre-race shake-out (if racing Sunday). Saturday/Sunday: RACE DAY!

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W12 Tue - Easy Spin
workouts.description:
• Duration: 30 min

• Zones: Z1-Z2 (55-70% FTP)

• Notes: Easy spin. Just moving legs. No stress.

• CADENCE: Self-selected (85-95 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1200" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.65" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W12 Wed - Final Openers
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
15 min easy → 3x4 min @ 90-95% FTP (3 min easy between) → 3x1 min @ 105% FTP (2 min easy between) → 3x30sec @ 110% FTP (90sec easy between) → 5 min easy

• Final intensity. Should feel powerful, snappy, explosive. If legs feel dead, skip the 30sec efforts. This is sharpness check.

• CADENCE WORK: High cadence on all efforts (100+ rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.70"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="240" OnPower="0.93" Cadence="100" OffDuration="180" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="60" OnPower="1.05" Cadence="100" OffDuration="120" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="30" OnPower="1.10" Cadence="100" OffDuration="90" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="300" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W12 Thu - Rest or Easy Spin
workouts.description:
• Optional: 20-30 min Z1

• Notes: If race is Sunday, easy spin. If race is Saturday, rest.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

workouts.name: W12 Fri - Pre-Race Shake-Out (if racing Sunday)
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
10 min easy → 2x3 min @ race pace (2 min easy between) → 2x1 min @ 105% FTP (2 min easy between) → 2x30sec @ 110% FTP (90sec easy between) → 5 min easy

• Final ride before race. Legs should feel fresh and powerful. Check bike. Visualize execution—conservative start, steady effort, strong finish.

• CADENCE WORK: High cadence on all efforts (100+ rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.70"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="600" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="180" OnPower="0.93" Cadence="100" OffDuration="120" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="60" OnPower="1.05" Cadence="100" OffDuration="120" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="30" OnPower="1.10" Cadence="100" OffDuration="90" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="300" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W12 Sat - Race Day or Rest
workouts.description:
• If racing Saturday: EXECUTE YOUR PLAN

• If racing Sunday: Rest or 20-30 min easy spin

• Notes: If racing today—start conservatively, fuel from mile 1 (50-60g carbs/hour minimum), use your FTP gains in final third. You trained smart. Race smart.

workouts.name: W12 Sun - Race Day or Recovery
workouts.description:
• If racing Sunday: EXECUTE YOUR PLAN

• If raced Saturday: Easy 20-30 min recovery spin, celebrate

• Notes: Race day. Conservative start. Aggressive fueling. When it gets hard in final third, you have the threshold fitness—12 weeks of G-Spot and Threshold built that. Push when others fade. Finish strong.

time_crunched_philosophy.description: Time-crunched training (3-5 hours/week) - maximum FTP gains with minimal time investment
time_crunched_philosophy.quality_sessions: 2-3 quality sessions per week, everything else rest or very light recovery
time_crunched_philosophy.principle: Every minute counts. No junk miles.

cadence_work.base_period: High cadence (100+ rpm seated) and low cadence/torque (40-60 rpm seated, big gear) on all intervals
cadence_work.build_period: Mix high/low cadence + rhythm intervals (2 min Z3 + 1 min Z4 patterns) + loaded intervals (1 min Z5/Z6 → settle into Z3)
cadence_work.description: Teaches power production in different ways, foundation for changing pace

rhythm_intervals.description: Alternating patterns: 2 min Z3 (self-selected cadence) + 1 min Z4 (high cadence 100+ rpm) x 3-4, continuous

loaded_intervals.description: 1 min Z5/Z6 (high cadence, seated) → settle into 9-14 min Z3 (self-selected cadence). Simulates race starts and surges.

strength_training.note: Athlete performs own strength program. Suggested on lighter training days. Time-crunched plans prioritize cycling work.

monday_week_preview.description: Monday rest days include week preview with key workouts, time-crunched reminders, FTP gains focus, and race execution guidance

time_crunched_considerations.quality_over_quantity: 2-3 quality sessions per week, everything else rest
time_crunched_considerations.aggressive_rest: Time-crunched = quality over quantity. Save energy for hard sessions.
time_crunched_considerations.ftp_focus: Maximum FTP gains and race-ready threshold power with minimal time investment
